page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: RECTORY PARK.THE HEY-DAY OF THORNHILL HALL) {Sir William Savile}was only 21 years of age when he was{Lord of the Manor} in 1634. In those days food, dancing and{hunting}appear to dominate the scene. Sir William fought in the{Civil {War.}He fought bravely and became Governor of York in 1638. He died when he was 32 years old. From 1641 to 1649 England was {divided}and{torn}by the Civil LWar. {Lady Anne Savile, widow}of Sir William, spent all her time{scheming for the King against{Parliamentarians. Soldiers{attacked}Thornhill Hall. After the attack the hall was almost {burnt}to the ground, and only a small part of the Hall is to be seen today.
